definition: hot spicy soup (often sold in street stalls)
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
to scald/to burn (by scalding)/to blanch (cooking)/to heat (sth) up in hot water/to perm/to iron/scalding hot

sentences.english: I think a great deal of Beijing winter and the malatang.
sentences.chinese: 我时常会想起北京的冬天和麻辣烫。

sentences.english: I should eat hemp hot iron and of chaffy dish dig, how does this face do?
sentences.chinese: 我要吃麻辣烫和火锅的挖，这个脸怎么办啊？

sentences.english: Standard recipe authentic Sichuan Malatang pot.
sentences.chinese: 正宗四川麻辣烫锅底的标准配方。

sentences.english: I recommend Ladies' Street. It's famous for the spicy hotchpotch.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐女人街，那儿的麻辣烫非常出名。

sentences.english: Always walk on the brighter side of your life.
sentences.chinese: 哦，我这边吃这个就叫麻辣烫，自己选菜，荤素都有。

sentences.english: Houhai lake in Central are sold Mala Tang, business everywhere ah.
sentences.chinese: 后海的湖中央有卖麻辣烫，生意无处不在啊。

definition: oden, Japanese dish made with boiled eggs, processed fish cakes, daikon radish, tofu etc in a kelp-based broth
Sichuan poached sliced fish in hot chili oil
duck's blood and beef tripe in spicy soup
Sichuan noodles with a spicy and numbing sauce
rice noodle soup from Yunnan province
